snippet: The campaigns roared back to life with urgent closing arguments and a flurry of cross-country rallies as Mitt Romney raced to overtake President Obama in the election’s final 100 hours.
abstract: Both presidential campaigns roar back to life, ending storm-imposed hiatus with urgent closing arguments and flurry of cross-country rallies; Mitt Romney races to overtake President Obama in election’s final 100 hours; national polls have them at virtual tie.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and MARK LANDLER
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Mark Landler from Las Vegas. Michael Barbaro contributed from Virginia.

lead_paragraph: The campaigns roared back to life with urgent closing arguments and a flurry of cross-country rallies as Mitt Romney raced to overtake President Obama in the election’s final 100 hours.

headline.seo: Storm-Imposed Intermission Over, Both Campaigns Rush Back Onto Stage
headline.main: After Storm Hiatus, Presidential Race Is Back in Full Swing
headline.print_headline: Storm-Imposed Intermission Over, Both Campaigns Rush Back Onto Stage
